Reviews.Title: Nice phone for first time cell phone users.
Reviews.Author: Scott Stevens
Reviews.Content: I did not purchase my Samsung T101G tracfone on Amazon but at the local Dollar General store.  It came with a packaged deal which included a belt clip carry case, phone car charger cord, ear phone piece and the free unlimited double minute plan.  All that for $10 (which is dam good considering if all these items were purchased separately would come to $65 total).  At that price I could not pass it up.  That being said, I am a first time user of cell phones and the Samsung T101G is what I am beginning with.  It is a great phone for first time ever cell phone users and is perfect for those who want a simple cell phone without all the fancy bells and whistles of the more expensive models.  I was looking for a phone to have for emergency purposes and for general contact with the outside world when I traveled and this particular model phone is perfected for that.  Reception has been decent in most areas and I have had no problems so far with making and receiving calls.  The phone has many other features like web browsing and text messaging with which I am still experimenting with, so I can't give you an honest review yet on those features.  But if your looking for a simple, inexpensive cell phone that does what a phone should do (make and receive calls) without all the fancy bells and whistles, the Samsung T101G is a excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: So many features, such a great phone
Reviews.Author: E. R
Reviews.Content: I am so glad that i purchased this phone, it accompanies me whereever i go. For the price i cannot believe you get so much, we are talking texting for 0.30 minutes out of 1.00 minute. calls overseeas for no more than calls made locally. I would recommend this phone, especially for emergencies, you only have to buy a $20 card every 3 months which can add up to 120 minutes

Reviews.Title: Serious Deficiencies, Useless Manual
Reviews.Author: Motor Head
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone from Target Stores because I wanted to try Tracfone as a cell phone service provider (according to Consumer Union, they are the best prepaid service provider).The phone has several serious deficiencies that cause a great deal of annoyance :- User manual is woefully inadequate (e.g. no explanation of auto lock feature, security, etc.)- User manual on Samsung's web site is only available as a pdf file and cannot be edited to print  as  individual pages- User manual that comes with the phone is equally inadequate- When you store the phone in its carry case and close the lid, the phone will  frequently turn on, since some of the buttons protrude. If you accidentally touch the "browser" button, you will be charged 0.5 minutes for access charges !Since this phone is likely to be be purchased by people who do not use a cell phone very often (for emergency contacts), the user instuctions need to be much more explicit/detailed, and the ergonomic design of operating buttons that can accidentally be activated leaves a lot to be desired. Overall, a big disappointment

Reviews.Title: inexpensive and simple
Reviews.Author: willie "roadie"
Reviews.Content: this phone is just the ticket to get revenge on Mother Bell or other carriers; at less than ten dinero at the local box-mart and with the addition of a 60-minute card at nineteen, you have phone service for (you do the math) a month! i was initially skeptical of pay-as-you-go, and didn't want to blow big bucks on a fancy gumstick - this was the cheapest way to go... and guess what? this thing works better than the moto from verizon, and my long-distance callers say the sound quality is better! plus, the service (since i use less than 20 minutes a month) is one-sixth my previous contract plan! why did i wait so long? this phone is simple, no-frills, has good sound, good battery life, and can be thrown away (recycled) with little remorse - this is a phone for practical people!

Reviews.Title: Simple cellphone, but can't be turned on and carried in holder or purse
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Sweeney Jr. "Flying Zamboni"
Reviews.Content: For a low cell phone bandwidth user like myself, I generally use the phone when I need roadside assistance or when I'll be home much later than planned, this seemed like the perfect fit for me.  It dials wells, wasn't too hard to set up, but the documentation as noted in other reviews is greatly lacking.However if the cellphone is on and I close its carrying case, it opens up the web browser and deducts 30 seconds immediately.  You can NOT have this phone on and carry it in it's case, your pocket or purse.  It will dial up the internet and cost you 30 seconds, and if you don't catch it, it will continue to do so every 30 seconds until you stop it.  I lost an hour worth of airtime due to this before I finally figured out what was happening.  Samsung should require a confirmation to logging into the internet with this phone.I'm trading this one in for a LG 420G flip phone, hopefully that one I'll be able to keep in my coat pocket without it dialing into the internet without my knowledge.

Reviews.Title: 5-Star Phone
Reviews.Author: A. Tweedle "Tweety-Bird"
Reviews.Content: Perfect little Samsung phone. Really easy to use, neat features, high quality, and stylish as well. Great monthly savings and coast to coast coverage with the Tracfone service too. It really offers you everything :) More people should hop on the prepaid wireless bandwagon - it's really too great of a deal to pass up. Great brand-name phones and the Tracfone service = perfection.

Reviews.Title: Samsung prepaid phone
Reviews.Author: gangster
Reviews.Content: Wasn't too happy with the phone. Did not like the features. Reordered a different phone, One that I was use to

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: ANA Coronado "Ana Co"
Reviews.Content: The Shipping was fast, I got what I was expecting. Bought these for a family trip we where having to the States. They came with 10 minutes...Worked just as advertised, and its easy to find the prepaid phone cards in Target and CVS.They where even cheaper than buying them at either stores too.

Reviews.Title: Great basic phone with unexpected signal range
Reviews.Author: Charles S. Tatakis "Chucktee"
Reviews.Content: I use this Tracfone when I travel and noted that it has gotten knocked for being a simple unit with a vague instruction manual. However, I really like this phone as I have been followed around by associates when I travel because it's the only phone that can link to the signal towers in the area.  Also, it very robust having been dropped many times. The battery lasts a couple of weeks between charges  with light usage, perhaps a few minutes per day. I've gone away for a week with multiple calls per day and the battery charge was adequate. Otherwise the circumstances would be very trying.The Blackberries and Iphones are superb business units but their range is limited. What's more annoying than being on location and unable to communicate, no signal? I've never had that problem but I've had to recently loan my phone to several others for that reason.We all should recall that this is a $20 phone and for that reason alone for the performance it represents it's an exemplary unit. It has never let me down during the dozens of client visits and I've purchased one for my wife to use during emergency calls as it is very dependable.On the road it's my business phone, alarm clock, timer, calculator and MMS unit. When you consider the price, there is none better.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this phone!
Reviews.Author: IMHO
Reviews.Content: The Samsung T101G phone is so bad I finally threw it away and bought a different phone.Even at the loudest setting, the ring tone was so quiet that I could not hear it when it was inside my purse; I had to leave it on top of the table. As others have said, the manual stinks and I was never able to lock the keypad so various buttons got pushed when it was in my pocket. And worst of all for me, the speakerphone was "On" and I could not turn it off. Not only could everybody around hear my converstions, but the person I was talking to could hardly hear me because of all the ambient noise (traffic, televisions, other conversations) being picked up by the speakerphone. Since all I need is a simple cell phone for emergencies, I bought an LG420G which works great. The Tracphone service is fine and cheap (especially with a double minutes card) so now I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Internet browser eats your minutes
Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: Like some of the others reviewing this phone, I had the same problem with the internet browser eating up my minutes.  If this phone is slightly bumped while in your purse or pocket, it activates the internet.  I called tracfone twice and also emailed them, and they told me to buy a case for the phone.  I asked them if there was a way to deactivate the browser button and they said no. Don't buy this phone, there's plenty of better ones out there.

Reviews.Title: Not a great phone.
Reviews.Author: Chrisangel
Reviews.Content: I got mine at Target for ten bucks and thought it was worth it. It is a durable phone. But whenever I'm working and it's in my pocket it either connects to the web accidentally because the browser button sticks out and before you realize it, you've burned up minutes on the web. And I BS you not, my phone somehow calls my local fire/emergency. This all happens when it's locked and in my pocket. WTH?

Reviews.Title: Don't even think of buying this; NO incoming calls yet!
Reviews.Author: Donald R. Hicks "Donald R Hicks"
Reviews.Content: This is my third tracphone... Each time there is a problem (same one) but this time I have learned my lesson.  BUY FROM any other company - you might get something worth using.  Tracfone has a great $ game - the phone comes with "FREE" Voicemail you cannot turn off.... but you cannot receive calls after activation until they initialize it after a customer service call - so every voicemail drains your minutes. Remember you cannot receive text or send or return the calls! I started with a $24 phone, $50 worth of minutes.... 4 hours with customer service and Service Supervisors who "hung-up" on me and refused to return any calls making me have to use long distance (international) to try and get an incoming call.  Finally, we just gave up.  We used the remaining few minutes to call out and threw the trash away. These people are rude, insensitive, and Tracfone is an expensive hoax!

Reviews.Title: christmas gift
Reviews.Author: barb plott
Reviews.Content: sorry this is a  christmas gifts not sure how to rate this phone at this time for christmas isnt here yet

Reviews.Title: Didn"t Work
Reviews.Author: E. Franklin Ross
Reviews.Content: The samsng phone i ordered from you would not take a program.the teack phone people and myself spent a good two and a half weeks on the land line trying to get it to work....Finally they gave up  and asked me to send them the phone and they would send me a replacement.I did and they did.They sent me a lg track phone..it took another week and a half to program it....I have never in my life been so flusterated at anything........my wife amd myself owened lg phones and they both went bad within a week of each other..........She went to a local store to purchase another phone.they in formed her that the lg,s we had is now discontinue..so they sold her another lg with better features.....me ? i am stuck with the same old lg phone.......I am a senior and have been concidering a jetter bug I have looked at my sister in laws and i can actually see the numbers and read and see the writting..Do you sale jitter bugs and the pckage that support them ? If so send me your info...Sorry about this and beleave me i left out a lot...like they beening track phone co. folkes cheated me or i should say shitted me me out of around 60 minutes during all of the fe- ass - co.........enough of this it's upsetting me agian........  Ernest Ross

ProductInfo.Features:
Slim candybar prepaid phone with text messaging, voicemail, caller ID, call waiting and multi-language support
Pay for only the calling time you use with minutes purchased from Tracfone--no annual contract required
Phonebook with up to 100 entries, organizer tools, hands-free speakerphone, and vibrating alert
Up to 4 hours of talk time, up to 456 hours (19 days) of standby time
What's in the Box: handset, battery, charger, user manual
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung T101G Prepaid Phone (Tracfone)
